intro: Catostemma sancarlosianum, commonly known as the San Carlos trumpetflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many milkweed-related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitats.
